description.zh-cn: 唐朝盛唐时期的著名诗人兼官员，号称“诗仙”，诗风飘逸奔放，富于独创性，充满浪漫主义情调。与杜甫并称“李杜”。
description.en: A famous Chinese poet and official of the High Tang period, known as the 'Poet Immortal'. His poetry is characterized by its imaginative, free-flowing, and romantic style. He and Du Fu are often referred to as 'Li-Du'.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝在位时间最长的皇帝，前期开创了开元盛世，后期因安史之乱而退位。
description.en: The longest-reigning emperor of the Tang dynasty, his early reign marked the prosperous Kaiyuan Era, while his later reign was marred by the An Lushan Rebellion, leading to his abdication.

description.zh-cn: 唐代设立的文学、艺术、技术等方面的机构，翰林供奉是其中一种官职。
description.en: An institution established during the Tang dynasty for literary, artistic, and technical scholars. Hanlin Attendant was a position within this academy.

description.zh-cn: 唐代于天宝十四载（755年）爆发的一场政治叛乱，是唐朝由盛转衰的转折点。
description.en: A political rebellion that began in 755 (14th year of the Tianbao era) during the Tang dynasty, marking the turning point from its golden age to its decline.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗第十六子，封永王。安史之乱时起兵，后被唐肃宗派兵平定，李白曾为其幕僚。
description.en: The 16th son of Emperor Xuanzong of Tang, enfeoffed as the Prince of Yong. He raised troops during the An Lushan Rebellion but was defeated by forces loyal to Emperor Suzong. Li Bai briefly served on his staff.

description.zh-cn: 唐代伟大的现实主义诗人，与李白合称“李杜”。
description.en: A great realist poet of the Tang dynasty, often paired with Li Bai as 'Li-Du'.

description.zh-cn: 唐代著名边塞诗人，曾与李白、杜甫交游。后官至淮南节度使。
description.en: A famous frontier poet of the Tang dynasty, who associated with Li Bai and Du Fu. He later became the military governor of Huainan.

description.zh-cn: 唐代著名山水田园派诗人，李白的好友，其诗风对李白有所启发。
description.en: A famous landscape and pastoral poet of the Tang dynasty, a friend of Li Bai, whose poetic style influenced him.

description.zh-cn: 唐代诗人、书法家，曾任秘书监。他非常欣赏李白的才华，称其为“谪仙人”，并向唐玄宗推荐。
description.en: A Tang dynasty poet and calligrapher who served as Supervisor of the Palace Library. He greatly admired Li Bai's talent, calling him a 'banished immortal,' and recommended him to Emperor Xuanzong.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗时期的著名宦官，权势极大。据传因李白醉酒命其脱靴而感到被冒犯，进而排挤李白。
description.en: A powerful and influential eunuch during the reign of Emperor Xuanzong. According to legend, he felt offended when a drunken Li Bai ordered him to remove his boots, leading him to ostracize the poet.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗的宠妃。据传因高力士的中伤而排斥李白。
description.en: The beloved consort of Emperor Xuanzong. It is said that she ostracized Li Bai due to the slanders of Gao Lishi.

description.zh-cn: 唐代道士，曾与李白交游。一说李白受其推荐而被唐玄宗征召。
description.en: A Daoist priest of the Tang dynasty who associated with Li Bai. One account suggests he recommended Li Bai to Emperor Xuanzong.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗的同母妹妹，爱好文艺与道教。曾推荐李白入宫，李白也曾做过其门客。
description.en: The full sister of Emperor Xuanzong, with interests in arts and Daoism. She recommended Li Bai to the court, and he once served as her guest-retainer.

description.zh-cn: 唐代名将，在平定安史之乱中功勋卓著。传说他曾受李白救助，后在李白因永王李璘案获罪时为其求情。
description.en: A renowned general of the Tang dynasty who played a crucial role in suppressing the An Lushan Rebellion. Legend holds that Li Bai once saved him, and he later interceded on Li Bai's behalf when the poet was implicated in the Prince of Yong's case.

description.zh-cn: 唐代官员，曾任御史中丞。在李白因永王李璘案被囚于寻阳时，因其父与李白有交情而释放了李白，并任其为僚属。
description.en: A Tang dynasty official who served as Censor-in-chief. When Li Bai was imprisoned in Xunyang for his involvement with the Prince of Yong, Song released him due to his father's prior friendship with the poet and made Li Bai a subordinate.

description.zh-cn: 唐代书法家、官员，李白的族叔。李白晚年投靠他，并托付诗稿，由他编成《草堂集》。
description.en: A Tang dynasty calligrapher, official, and a clan uncle of Li Bai. In his later years, Li Bai sought refuge with him and entrusted him with his manuscripts, which Li Yangbing compiled into the 'Caotang Ji' (Grass Hut Collection).

description.zh-cn: 中国本土宗教和哲学传统，对李白的思想和创作产生了深刻影响，李白本人笃信道教并曾受道箓。
description.en: A native Chinese religious and philosophical tradition that profoundly influenced Li Bai's thought and works. Li Bai himself was a devout Daoist and received ordination.

description.zh-cn: 源于古印度的宗教，对中国文化有深远影响。李白对佛教有深入了解，并自称“青莲居士”，常在诗歌中运用佛教典故和思想。
description.en: A religion originating in ancient India that has had a profound impact on Chinese culture. Li Bai was well-versed in Buddhism, called himself the 'Blue Lotus Layman,' and often used Buddhist allusions and ideas in his poetry.

description.zh-cn: 唐代道士，李白的挚友，两人交往甚密，常一同隐居、游历。
description.en: A Daoist priest of the Tang dynasty and a close friend of Li Bai. They associated closely, often living in seclusion and traveling together.

description.zh-cn: 唐代道教上清派一代宗师。他曾称赞年轻的李白有“仙风道骨”，对李白有重要影响。
description.en: A patriarch of the Shangqing school of Daoism during the Tang dynasty. He famously praised the young Li Bai for having an 'immortal's air and Daoist bones,' exerting a significant influence on him.

description.zh-cn: 李白的父亲。
description.en: The father of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李白的儿子。
description.en: The son of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李白的儿子。
description.en: The son of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李白的女儿。
description.en: The daughter of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 唐代绵州下的一个县，今属四川省江油市。是李白的一个出生地说法。
description.en: A county under Mianzhou during the Tang dynasty, now part of Jiangyou, Sichuan Province. It is one of the claimed birthplaces of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李客是李白的父亲。
description.en: Li Ke was Li Bai's father.

description.zh-cn: 李伯禽是李白的儿子。
description.en: Li Boqin was Li Bai's son.

description.zh-cn: 李天然是李白的儿子。
description.en: Li Tianran was Li Bai's son.

description.zh-cn: 李平阳是李白的女儿。
description.en: Li Pingyang was Li Bai's daughter.

description.zh-cn: 根据多种记载，李白出生于唐朝绵州彰明县。
description.en: According to multiple records, Li Bai was born in Zhangming County, Mianzhou during the Tang dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 742年（天宝元年），李白获唐玄宗征召入京，开启了他人生最光辉的时期。
description.en: In 742 (first year of the Tianbao era), Li Bai was summoned to the capital by Emperor Xuanzong, beginning the most glorious period of his life.

description.zh-cn: 李白入京后担任翰林供奉，成为宫廷诗人，但两年后即请辞离京。
description.en: After arriving at the capital, Li Bai served as a Hanlin Attendant and became a court poet, but he resigned and left the capital two years later.

description.zh-cn: 贺知章在长安初见李白时，对其诗才大加赞赏，称其为“谪仙人”，他的激赏使得李白的名字得以传入唐玄宗耳中。
description.en: When He Zhizhang first met Li Bai in Chang'an, he highly praised his poetic talent, calling him a 'banished immortal'. His admiration helped Li Bai's name reach Emperor Xuanzong.

description.zh-cn: 根据一种说法，李白是受道士吴筠的推荐而被唐玄宗征召入京。
description.en: According to one account, Li Bai was recommended by the Daoist priest Wu Yun, which led to his being summoned to the capital by Emperor Xuanzong.

description.zh-cn: 玉真公主是推荐李白入宫的关键人物之一。
description.en: Princess Yuzhen was one of the key figures who recommended Li Bai to the court.

description.zh-cn: 738年秋，李白曾在玉真公主于终南山的别馆做门客。
description.en: In the autumn of 738, Li Bai served as a guest-retainer at Princess Yuzhen's villa in the Zhongnan Mountains.

description.zh-cn: 据传，李白曾醉令高力士为其脱靴，冒犯了高力士，后者因此向杨贵妃进谗言中伤李白，导致李白被排挤。
description.en: According to legend, Li Bai, while drunk, ordered Gao Lishi to remove his boots, which offended the eunuch. Gao subsequently slandered Li Bai to Yang Guifei, leading to the poet's ostracism.

description.zh-cn: 因高力士的中伤，指出李白曾用自杀的赵飞燕比喻她，杨贵妃也开始排斥李白。
description.en: Influenced by Gao Lishi's slander, which pointed out that Li Bai had compared her to the suicidal Zhao Feiyan, Yang Guifei also began to ostracize Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 744年秋，李白在汴州、宋州一带与杜甫、高适交游，一同游览、畅谈痛饮。
description.en: In the autumn of 744, Li Bai associated with Du Fu and Gao Shi in the regions of Bianzhou and Songzhou, traveling, talking, and drinking together.

description.zh-cn: 744年秋，李白与杜甫、高适在汴州、宋州一带交游。
description.en: In the autumn of 744, Li Bai associated with Du Fu and Gao Shi in the regions of Bianzhou and Songzhou.

description.zh-cn: 李白因永王李璘案被囚于寻阳狱中时，曾向时任淮南节度使的故友高适求救，但未获援手。
description.en: When Li Bai was imprisoned in Xunyang for his involvement in the Prince of Yong's case, he sought help from his old friend Gao Shi, who was then the military governor of Huainan, but received no assistance.

description.zh-cn: 李白约在724年出蜀东游，在襄阳认识了孟浩然。
description.en: Around 724, while traveling east from Shu, Li Bai met Meng Haoran in Xiangyang.

description.zh-cn: 李白结交孟浩然并深受其敬慕，受其启发后诗风为之一变，变得清新奔放。
description.en: Li Bai befriended and deeply admired Meng Haoran; inspired by him, his poetic style changed, becoming fresher and more unrestrained.

description.zh-cn: 安史之乱爆发后，李白南奔避乱，后因加入永王李璘阵营，在李璘兵败后被牵连获罪，流放夜郎，人生遭遇重大挫折。
description.en: After the An Lushan Rebellion broke out, Li Bai fled south to escape the chaos. He later joined the Prince of Yong's camp and was implicated, convicted, and exiled to Yelang after the prince's defeat, marking a major setback in his life.

description.zh-cn: 756年末，永王李璘率水军东下，李白应聘加入其幕府。
description.en: At the end of 756, when the Prince of Yong, Li Lin, led his naval forces east, Li Bai accepted an invitation to join his staff.

description.zh-cn: 永王李璘起兵失败后，李白作为其幕僚受到牵连，被判流放夜郎。
description.en: After the failure of the Prince of Yong's uprising, Li Bai, as a member of his staff, was implicated and sentenced to exile in Yelang.

description.zh-cn: 757年秋，御史中丞宋若思因其父与李白有旧交，将囚于寻阳狱中的李白释放。
description.en: In the autumn of 757, the Censor-in-chief Song Ruosi released Li Bai from prison in Xunyang, owing to a past friendship between his father and the poet.

description.zh-cn: 被宋若思释放后，李白曾短暂留作其僚属。
description.en: After being released by Song Ruosi, Li Bai briefly served as his subordinate.

description.zh-cn: 根据传说，郭子仪为报答李白早年的救助之恩，在李白因永王案获罪时，以自己的官爵为李白求情，使其免于死刑，改判流放夜郎。
description.en: According to legend, to repay Li Bai for saving him in his youth, Guo Ziyi interceded on Li Bai's behalf when he was convicted in the Prince of Yong case, offering his own official rank to save him from execution, resulting in the sentence being commuted to exile in Yelang.

description.zh-cn: 李白晚年病重时，前往当涂投靠族叔李阳冰，得到其照顾。去世后，李阳冰将李白的诗文编成《草堂集》。
description.en: In his later years, when he was seriously ill, Li Bai went to Dangtu to seek refuge with his clan uncle Li Yangbing, who took care of him. After his death, Li Yangbing compiled his poems into the 'Caotang Ji' (Grass Hut Collection).

description.zh-cn: 李阳冰是李白的族叔。
description.en: Li Yangbing was Li Bai's clan uncle.

description.zh-cn: 李白笃信道教，热切向往神仙不死，并曾在齐州从道士高如贵处领受道箓，正式成为道教徒。
description.en: Li Bai was a devout follower of Daoism, fervently yearning for immortality. He formally became a Daoist practitioner after receiving ordination from the priest Gao Rugui in Qizhou.

description.zh-cn: 李白对佛教有精深造诣，能纯熟掌握其思想，自称“青莲居士”，作品中也常体现佛教影响。
description.en: Li Bai had a profound understanding of Buddhism and mastered its concepts. He called himself the 'Blue Lotus Layman,' and Buddhist influences are often reflected in his works.

description.zh-cn: 道教宗师司马承祯曾称赞年轻的李白有“仙风道骨”，对李白产生了重要影响，李白作《大鹏遇希有鸟赋》以纪念此事。
description.en: The Daoist master Sima Chengzhen once praised the young Li Bai for having an 'immortal's air and Daoist bones,' which had a significant influence on him. Li Bai wrote the 'Rhapsody on the Great Peng Bird Meeting the Xiyou Bird' to commemorate this event.

description.zh-cn: 元丹丘是李白毕生的挚友，两人常一同游历、隐居、访道。
description.en: Yuan Danqiu was a lifelong close friend of Li Bai; they often traveled, lived in seclusion, and sought the Dao together.
